title: World
description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.

items.title: Garbage collectors in Kharkiv dodge mortars to pick up the trash
items.content_html: In Ukraine's second largest city, Kharkiv, Russian forces continue to pound neighborhoods in the north and east. But city garbage collectors are still picking up the trash.
items.summary: In Ukraine's second largest city, Kharkiv, Russian forces continue to pound neighborhoods in the north and east. But city garbage collectors are still picking up the trash.

items.title: The UK defense minister rules himself out of the race to succeed Boris Johnson
items.content_html: Ben Wallace had been tipped to be a frontrunner in the Conservative Party's leadership race — and to serve as the country's prime minister.
items.summary: Ben Wallace had been tipped to be a frontrunner in the Conservative Party's leadership race — and to serve as the country's prime minister.

items.title: Shinzo Abe's party scores a major victory in Japan's election, early results show
items.content_html: The victory is possibly propelled by what is seen as a wave of sympathy votes in a country still reeling from the shock of the former prime minister's assassination.
items.summary: The victory is possibly propelled by what is seen as a wave of sympathy votes in a country still reeling from the shock of the former prime minister's assassination.

items.title: Scores of people may be trapped after a rocket hit an apartment in Ukraine
items.content_html: A Russian rocket attack hit the town of Chasiv Yar, destroying a five-story apartment building and killing at least 15 people.
items.summary: A Russian rocket attack hit the town of Chasiv Yar, destroying a five-story apartment building and killing at least 15 people.

items.title: A group of people opened fire at a bar in South Africa, killing 15
items.content_html: A mass shooting at a tavern in Johannesburg's Soweto township has killed at least 15 people and left others in critical condition.
items.summary: A mass shooting at a tavern in Johannesburg's Soweto township has killed at least 15 people and left others in critical condition.

items.title: Shinzo Abe's policies take on renewed significance for Japan
items.content_html: The assassination of the former prime minister has prompted the world to reflect on his policies and what they actually accomplished.
items.summary: The assassination of the former prime minister has prompted the world to reflect on his policies and what they actually accomplished.

items.title: Angola's José Eduardo dos Santos, once one of Africa's longest-serving rulers, dies
items.content_html: Dos Santos died at 79 after a long illness. Under his watch, Angola became sub-Saharan Africa's second-largest oil producer — but the wealth didn't reach the people.
items.summary: Dos Santos died at 79 after a long illness. Under his watch, Angola became sub-Saharan Africa's second-largest oil producer — but the wealth didn't reach the people.

items.title: Luis Echeverria, a Mexican leader who was blamed for massacres, dies at age 100
items.content_html: The former president, blamed for some of Mexico's worst political killings of the 20th century, has died at the age of 100, current President Andrés Manuel López Obrador confirmed.
items.summary: The former president, blamed for some of Mexico's worst political killings of the 20th century, has died at the age of 100, current President Andrés Manuel López Obrador confirmed.

items.title: Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina wins her first Grand Slam title at Wimbledon
items.content_html: The 23-year-old is bringing her adopted country its first singles trophy at a major tournament.
items.summary: The 23-year-old is bringing her adopted country its first singles trophy at a major tournament.

items.title: What we know so far about former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's assassination
items.content_html: Tetsuya Yamagami, the unemployed 41-year-old who confessed to assassinating Shinzo Abe, reportedly planned the attack for months. He told police his motivations were not political.
items.summary: Tetsuya Yamagami, the unemployed 41-year-old who confessed to assassinating Shinzo Abe, reportedly planned the attack for months. He told police his motivations were not political.

items.title: U.S. tells China that its support for Russia in Ukraine complicates relations
items.content_html: China's support for Russia's war in Ukraine is complicating U.S.-Chinese relations at an already difficult time, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken told his Chinese counterpart.
items.summary: China's support for Russia's war in Ukraine is complicating U.S.-Chinese relations at an already difficult time, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken told his Chinese counterpart.

items.title: PHOTOS: South Africa's 'train of hope' is a godsend for millions. But new threats loom
items.content_html: Dubbed the "train of hope," the Phelophepa has brought health care to millions of South Africans. But it's facing an unprecedented spree of theft and vandalism on the country's railways.
items.summary: Dubbed the "train of hope," the Phelophepa has brought health care to millions of South Africans. But it's facing an unprecedented spree of theft and vandalism on the country's railways.

items.title: As gun violence rises in Canada, weapons from the U.S. complicate gun control efforts
items.content_html: A bill before Canada's Parliament aims to stop the spread of handguns — but one of the most difficult challenges for Canada is the guns being smuggled over the border from the U.S.
items.summary: A bill before Canada's Parliament aims to stop the spread of handguns — but one of the most difficult challenges for Canada is the guns being smuggled over the border from the U.S.

items.title: This Eid al-Adha, the new rules for hajj have left many frustrated
items.content_html: The Saudi Arabian government's new rules for the pilgrimage left many Muslims frustrated and disappointed. Some couldn't make the journey, and others were shocked by the conditions upon arrival.
items.summary: The Saudi Arabian government's new rules for the pilgrimage left many Muslims frustrated and disappointed. Some couldn't make the journey, and others were shocked by the conditions upon arrival.

items.title: Sri Lanka's opposition parties hope to install a new government amid the turmoil
items.content_html: A lawmaker said all opposition parties combined could easily muster the 113 members needed to show a majority in Parliament, at which point they will request a new government.
items.summary: A lawmaker said all opposition parties combined could easily muster the 113 members needed to show a majority in Parliament, at which point they will request a new government.

items.title: Biden is building on the Abraham Accords, part of Trump's legacy in the Middle East
items.content_html: Joe Biden has jettisoned most of his predecessor's foreign policy. But not the Abraham Accords. Those agreements between Israel and its neighbors are in the spotlight as Biden heads to the Mideast.
items.summary: Joe Biden has jettisoned most of his predecessor's foreign policy. But not the Abraham Accords. Those agreements between Israel and its neighbors are in the spotlight as Biden heads to the Mideast.

items.title: UN fails to extend aid deliveries to Syrian rebel-held area
items.content_html: The U.N. Security Council failed in two rival votes Friday to extend humanitarian aid deliveries from Turkey to 4.1 million Syrians in the rebel-held northwest.
items.summary: The U.N. Security Council failed in two rival votes Friday to extend humanitarian aid deliveries from Turkey to 4.1 million Syrians in the rebel-held northwest.

items.title: Ukrainians have a special place in their hearts for Boris Johnson
items.content_html: While Britons might be happy to see their prime minister go, Ukrainians hold him in higher regard.
items.summary: While Britons might be happy to see their prime minister go, Ukrainians hold him in higher regard.

items.title: Coronavirus FAQ: I took a trip and caught COVID. What should I do? When can I go home?
items.content_html: As summer travel surges, so does COVID. Experts share advice on how to prepare ahead of time in case you are infected on a vacation or visit — and what to do if you get that dreaded positive test.
items.summary: As summer travel surges, so does COVID. Experts share advice on how to prepare ahead of time in case you are infected on a vacation or visit — and what to do if you get that dreaded positive test.

items.title: Shinzo Abe, killed at 67, leaves a storied legacy as Japan's longest-serving premier
items.content_html: The influential prime minister worked to revive the economy with his trademark "Abenomics" and rebuild Japan's role on the global stage. His assassination stunned a nation where gun violence is rare.
items.summary: The influential prime minister worked to revive the economy with his trademark "Abenomics" and rebuild Japan's role on the global stage. His assassination stunned a nation where gun violence is rare.

items.title: Tasman Keith didn't come here to point fingers
items.content_html: The First Nations rapper comes from "a place of understanding [that] at the end of the day everybody is human and we all have a lack of knowledge that we can expand on." His debut album is out today.
items.summary: The First Nations rapper comes from "a place of understanding [that] at the end of the day everybody is human and we all have a lack of knowledge that we can expand on." His debut album is out today.

items.title: There's nowhere in Ukraine to hide from the war. This café tries to help people cope
items.content_html: In western Ukraine, far from the front lines, Ruslana Mikhaluk hires a clown to give children a night of laughter and fun. She doesn't plan to make a profit this year at her seasonal café.
items.summary: In western Ukraine, far from the front lines, Ruslana Mikhaluk hires a clown to give children a night of laughter and fun. She doesn't plan to make a profit this year at her seasonal café.
